question.text: There are five alleles of a particular gene in a population. The total number of different genotypes (for this allele) in the population will be

solution.text: Consider the four alleles in the population to be A1, A2, A3, A4 and A5. An individual can have only two alleles at a time. So the various genotypes will be A1A1, A1A2, A1A3, A1A4, A1A5, A2A2, A2A3, A2A4, A2A5, A3A3, A3A4, A3A5, A4A4, A4A5, A5A5 (total 15). The general formula for types of genotypes is <math><mrow><mrow><mfenced close="]" open="[" separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow><mo>/</mo><mrow><mn>2, </mn></mrow></mrow></math>where n is the number of alleles in the population.
